alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Somerset, southeastern Wicomico and southwestern Worcester Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 333 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Snow Hill, or 9 miles east of University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Snow Hill and Newark around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Longridge, Salisbury-Wicomico, Cokesbury, Powellville, Mount Wesley, Whiton, Girdletree, Whitesburg and Stockton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
